content:
INVESTIGATIONAL DEVICE EXEMPTION (IDE) PROTOCOL
TEST CLINICAL STUDY FOR DEVICE
IDE Number: PENDING
Protocol Number: TEST-001-2024

## 1. PROTOCOL SUMMARY

### Study Title
Test Clinical Study for Device

### Sponsor
Test Sponsor Corporation


### Protocol Number
TEST-001-2024

### Study Phase
Phase 3

### Regulatory Classification
Device

## 2. STUDY OBJECTIVES

### Primary Objective
To evaluate the safety and efficacy of the investigational product.

### Primary Endpoint
Primary efficacy endpoint at 12 months

### Secondary Objectives
To be determined based on study design.

## 3. STUDY DESIGN

### Design Type
Randomized

### Study Duration
To be determined

### Number of Subjects
100 subjects will be enrolled

### Study Population
Adults meeting inclusion/exclusion criteria

## 4. INVESTIGATIONAL PRODUCT


## 5. ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA

### Inclusion Criteria
Adults aged 18-75 with confirmed diagnosis

### Exclusion Criteria
Pregnant women, severe comorbidities

## 6. STUDY PROCEDURES

### Screening
Screening will occur within 30 days prior to enrollment.

### Treatment Period
Treatment procedures will be conducted according to the protocol schedule.

### Follow-up
Subjects will be followed for safety and efficacy endpoints.

## 7. SAFETY MONITORING

### Safety Parameters
Safety will be assessed through adverse event monitoring, laboratory tests, and vital signs.

### Data Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB)
An independent DSMB will review safety data periodically.

### Stopping Rules
The study may be stopped for safety concerns as determined by the DSMB.

## 8. STATISTICAL CONSIDERATIONS

### Sample Size Calculation
Sample size of 100 provides adequate power for the primary endpoint.

### Statistical Analysis Plan
Primary analysis will be conducted on the intent-to-treat population.

### Interim Analysis
No interim analysis is planned.

## 9. ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS

### IRB Review
This protocol will be reviewed and approved by the Institutional Review Board prior to study initiation.

### Informed Consent
All subjects will provide written informed consent prior to any study procedures.

### Risk-Benefit Assessment
The potential benefits of the study outweigh the risks to participants.

## 10. REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS


### Good Clinical Practice
This study will be conducted in accordance with ICH GCP guidelines and applicable regulations.

## 11. REFERENCES

1. ICH E6(R2) Good Clinical Practice Guidelines
2. FDA Guidance Documents
3. Sponsor Protocol Development Guidelines

---
*Version: 1.0*
*Date: DRAFT*


## DEVICE-SPECIFIC SECTIONS

### A. DEVICE DESCRIPTION AND SPECIFICATIONS

#### Device Name
Test Medical Device

#### Device Classification
Class III

#### Intended Use
The device is intended for...

#### Device Components
The investigational device consists of...

#### Mechanism of Action
The device functions by...

### B. PRECLINICAL TESTING

#### Bench Testing
Bench testing has demonstrated...

#### Animal Studies
Preclinical animal studies showed...

#### Biocompatibility
Biocompatibility testing per ISO 10993...

### C. MANUFACTURING INFORMATION

#### Manufacturing Site
To be provided

#### Quality System
Manufactured under 21 CFR 820 Quality System Regulation

#### Sterilization Method
Ethylene oxide sterilization

### D. DEVICE ACCOUNTABILITY

#### Device Tracking
All investigational devices will be tracked using unique serial numbers.

#### Device Storage
Store at controlled room temperature (20-25°C)

#### Device Disposition
All devices will be returned to sponsor or destroyed per protocol

### E. TRAINING REQUIREMENTS

#### Investigator Training
All investigators must complete device-specific training prior to first subject enrollment

#### Procedure Requirements
Device implantation/use must be performed by qualified physicians

### F. DEVICE-RELATED ADVERSE EVENTS

#### Anticipated Device-Related Events
- Device malfunction
- Device migration
- Device-related infection

#### Unanticipated Adverse Device Effects (UADE) Reporting
UADEs will be reported to FDA within 10 working days of sponsor awareness.

### G. DEVICE DEFICIENCIES AND RECALLS

#### Device Deficiency Reporting
Any device deficiencies will be documented and reported per 21 CFR 812.

#### Recall Procedures
In the event of a device recall, all sites will be notified immediately
